page.title: 07The 1984-5 Miners strike.
page.content:
The year of the strike was a very miserable one for me as a miners son.At first it did not affect me much,but as it dragged on the whole family was affected.I did not get any pocket money and had to earn 'spending money' by collecting poor quality coal from old colliery slagheaps.I used to go 'coal-picking',as this was called,every Saturday.As money got short we were given free food which we collected from the Miners Welfare.
During the winter it was very cold in our house.We burnt coal which my dad and I picked,and wood from the local woods.Now the strike is over we are still paying off bills which we could not pay then.
